patterns: What can I see on dashboard?
responses: The Dashboard is your main control center showing real-time monitoring of your irrigation system. It displays: 1) **Quick Stats Cards**: Temperature, Humidity, Soil Moisture 2) **System Status**: Pump and Valve status 3) **Recent Sensor Data**: Historical readings table 4) **Quick Actions**: Links to Manual Control, Analytics, and Scheduling.

Current Temperature: {% if sensor_data.0.temperature %}{{ sensor_data.0.temperature|floatformat:1 }}°C{% else %}No data available{% endif %}. This is measured from environmental sensors and updated in real-time. Last updated: {{ sensor_data.0.timestamp|date:"M d, H:i" }}.

Current Humidity: {% if sensor_data.0.humidity %}{{ sensor_data.0.humidity|floatformat:1 }}%{% else %}No data available{% endif %}. This measures the amount of water vapor in the air. Last updated: {{ sensor_data.0.timestamp|date:"M d, H:i" }}.

Current Soil Moisture: {% if sensor_data.0.moisture %}{{ sensor_data.0.moisture|floatformat:1 }}%{% else %}No data available{% endif %}. This measures how much water is in the soil. Ideal levels are typically between 20-40% for most crops. Last updated: {{ sensor_data.0.timestamp|date:"M d, H:i" }}.

Pump Status: {{ sensor_data.0.pump_status|yesno:"ON,OFF" }}. The pump is currently {% if sensor_data.0.pump_status %}running and actively moving water{% else %}stopped and not circulating water{% endif %}. Last updated: {{ sensor_data.0.timestamp|date:"M d, H:i" }}.

Valve Status: {{ sensor_data.0.valve_status|yesno:"OPEN,CLOSED" }}. Water flow is currently {% if sensor_data.0.valve_status %}active and allowed through the system{% else %}blocked and not passing through{% endif %}. Last updated: {{ sensor_data.0.timestamp|date:"M d, H:i" }}.

The Recent Sensor Data table shows the last {{ sensor_data|length }} records with: Timestamp, Temperature (°C), Humidity (%), Moisture (%), Pump Status, and Valve Status. You can download this data in CSV or Excel format for further analysis.

To download sensor data: 1) Click either the 'CSV' or 'Excel' button above the sensor data table 2) Confirm the download in the popup modal 3) The file will download automatically. CSV is good for spreadsheets, Excel format includes formatting for easier analysis.

Access Manual Control through: 1) Click the 'Manual Control' quick action card on the dashboard 2) Or go to Control Panel [Link: {% url 'control-panel' %}] 3) From there you can override automatic settings and control pumps/valves directly. Use this for testing or emergency adjustments.

Access Analytics through: 1) Click the 'View Analytics' quick action card on the dashboard 2) Or go to Analytics page [Link: {% url 'visualize-data' %}] 3) There you'll find detailed charts, graphs, and trends of your sensor data over time for better decision making.

Access Scheduling through: 1) Click the 'Schedule' quick action card on the dashboard 2) Or go to Control Panel → Scheduling [Link: {% url 'control-panel' %}] 3) There you can set automatic watering times, durations, and conditions for your irrigation system.

Data Interpretation Guide: 1) **Temperature**: Ideal 18-27°C for most crops 2) **Humidity**: 40-60% optimal for plant health 3) **Soil Moisture**: 20-40% typically ideal (varies by crop) 4) **Pump Status**: ON=Water circulating, OFF=System idle 5) **Valve Status**: OPEN=Water flowing, CLOSED=Water blocked. Values outside normal ranges may need attention.

Sensor Data Update Frequency: 1) **Real-time readings**: Updated every 5-10 seconds 2) **Dashboard refresh**: Automatically updates every 30 seconds 3) **Historical data**: Records kept for 30 days minimum 4) **Data timestamp**: Each reading shows exact measurement time. You can manually refresh by reloading the page.

If data shows '--' or is missing: 1) Check sensor connections 2) Verify system is online (green connection indicator) 3) Ensure sensors are properly installed 4) Check for error messages 5) Try refreshing the page. If persistent, check the Help section or contact support.

Ideal Values for Most Crops: 1) **Temperature**: 18-27°C (64-80°F) 2) **Humidity**: 40-60% relative humidity 3) **Soil Moisture**: 20-40% (varies by crop type) 4) **Pump Operation**: Run during cooler parts of day 5) **Valve Timing**: Water based on soil moisture needs. Specific crops may have different optimal ranges.

Quick Actions provide one-click access to: 1) **Manual Control**: Override automatic settings [Link: {% url 'control-panel' %}] 2) **View Analytics**: Detailed charts and trends [Link: {% url 'visualize-data' %}] 3) **Schedule**: Set irrigation timing and automation. These are the most frequently used features for system management.

patterns: How far back can I see?
responses: Data Retention Policy: 1) **Real-time data**: 48 hours at high frequency 2) **Detailed history**: 30 days at 5-minute intervals 3) **Summary data**: 1 year at hourly intervals 4) **Export capability**: You can download data for permanent storage 5) **Auto-cleanup**: Older data is automatically archived or removed based on storage limits.

To refresh dashboard data: 1) **Automatic**: Data updates every 30 seconds 2) **Manual**: Refresh the browser page (F5 or reload button) 3) **Force update**: Click any navigation item and return to dashboard 4) **Check connection**: Ensure green online indicator is showing for live data.

The system supports multiple sensors: 1) **Multiple zones**: Can monitor different field areas 2) **Sensor groups**: Organize by crop type or location 3) **Comparative data**: View different zones simultaneously 4) **Individual control**: Manage each zone separately. Contact support to set up additional sensors or zones beyond the default configuration.
